selected_quotes: Absolute quantification by droplet digital PCR versus analog real-time PCR - superior precision, equal sensitivity
AOP: Droplet digital PCR is more precise and reproducible than RT-PCR, but not more sensitive. ($)
Caught end of Muneesh Tewari (UMich) 'Circulating microRNAs'. Cited 2013 ref cp between ddPCR qRT-PCR #AACR15

citation.abstract: Nanoliter-sized droplet technology paired with digital PCR (ddPCR) holds promise for highly precise, absolute nucleic acid quantification. Our comparison of microRNA quantification by ddPCR and real-time PCR revealed greater precision (coefficients of variation decreased 37-86%) and improved day-to-day reproducibility (by a factor of seven) of ddPCR but with comparable sensitivity. When we applied ddPCR to serum microRNA biomarker analysis, this translated to superior diagnostic performance for identifying individuals with cancer.
citation.title: Absolute quantification by droplet digital PCR versus analog real-time PCR

news.title: ddPCR technology can be used to reproducibly quantify microRNA in plasma
news.summary: A study published online in Nature Methods today demonstrated that Droplet Digital PCR (ddPCR-) technology can be used to precisely and reproducibly quantify microRNA (miRNA) in plasma and serum across different days, paving the way for further development

news.title: Droplet Digital PCR enables reproducible quantification of microRNA biomarkers
news.summary: ( Chempetitive Group ) MicroRNA can be reproducibly quantified using droplet digital PCR, paving the way for their further development as circulating biomarkers.
